metadata.title: CVE-2022-48626 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: moxart:fix potential use-after-free on remove path It was reported that the mmchost structure could be accessed after it was freed in moxart_remove(), sofix this by saving the base register of the device and using it instead ofthe pointer dereference.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1').
